tests.prompt: DeathSaveState and DeathSaveResult types exist in rulebooks/dnd5e/saves/ with all required fields (successes, failures, stabilized, dead, conscious flags)
Rolling a 1 on a death save adds 2 failures to DeathSaveState
Rolling 2-9 on a death save adds 1 failure to DeathSaveState
Rolling 10-19 on a death save adds 1 success to DeathSaveState
Rolling a 20 on a death save sets conscious=true and result indicates regaining 1 HP
Accumulating 3 failures sets dead=true on DeathSaveState
Accumulating 3 successes sets stabilized=true on DeathSaveState
TakeDamageWhileUnconscious adds 1 failure for normal damage
TakeDamageWhileUnconscious adds 2 failures for critical hit damage
All unit tests for death saves pass with go test
